docs.snippet: Jon Niese pitched his best game since late June in a victory over the Phillies on Monday, but Jacob deGrom headed to the 15-day disabled list....
docs.lead_paragraph: Jon Niese pitched his best game since late June in a victory over the Phillies on Monday, but Jacob deGrom headed to the 15-day disabled list.
docs.abstract: New York Mets beat Philadelphia Phillies, 5-3.

headline.main: Mets Breathe Easier as Niese Gets His First Win Since a D.L. Stint

docs.snippet: Chris Davis and Nelson Cruz each blasted a two-run home run and Jonathan Schoop added a three-run shot in the eighth to bury the Yankees, and stretch Baltimore’s lead in the A.L. East to seven games....
docs.lead_paragraph: Chris Davis and Nelson Cruz each blasted a two-run home run and Jonathan Schoop added a three-run shot in the eighth to bury the Yankees, and stretch Baltimore’s lead in the A.L. East to seven games.
docs.abstract: Baltimore Orioles rout New York Yankees, 11-3.

headline.main: Yanks Botch Chance to Narrow Gap

docs.snippet: Justin Verlander left after one inning with right shoulder soreness after allowing five runs — four earned — on four hits, walking two and striking out three....
docs.lead_paragraph: Justin Verlander left after one inning with right shoulder soreness after allowing five runs — four earned — on four hits, walking two and striking out three.
docs.abstract: Baseball Roundup; Pittsburgh Pirates defeat Detroit Tigers, 11-6; other scores noted.

docs.snippet: Michael Pineda, who strained a muscle during a suspension for using pine tar in an April game, had been scheduled for another rehabilitation start, but the Yankees determined he was ready to return this week....
